page.title: 09AN ARABLE FARM
page.content: The farmer has lived on this farm for 45 years. He took it over from his father in 1969. Winter corn, sown in autumn, is the main crop. Bad weather delayed this year's corn harvest. Use of chemicals and the varieties of corn grown ensure a heavy yield. Farm work is mechanised as far as possible for efficiency. Crops are chosen to accommodate the land and to allow for damage caused by deer and rabbits. A typical day begins at 7.45. Break- fast is followed by telephone calls, planning the day's work (depending on the weather), and opening mail. Meals are taken at variable times when a job is finished. Work continues throughout daylight hours. The size of the farm house and farm buildings enable the farmer to indulge his boyhood interest in steam engines, both model and full size.
